intro: Sida pseudopotentilloides var. manresana, commonly known as the Manresan sida, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, pale green to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It has hairy stems and leaves with a rough texture, and its flowers are usually arranged in clusters. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
